Masks

Masks have a long history. From Iranian masks protecting women from the patriarchal oppression of Portuguese colonizers, to masks of Northwest Coast Indian masks with mythical representations, to masks worn as a political statement either for solidarity or to disguise the identity of a protestor from CCTV cameras, they take on different religious, social, political and philosophical roles. Moreover masks also serve as a protective tool from pollution and diseases, especially in times of epidemics and pandemics, such as Spanish flu, SARS and today COVID19.
